data.title: Apollo Walk of Fame inducts Kenneth âBabyfaceâ Edmonds
data.meta_description: It was a star-studded event outside the theater with Clive Davis, Mary J. Blige and Fat Joe in attendance.
data.text:
Kenneth âBabyfaceâ Edmonds, a 13-time Grammy-Award winner, was inducted into the Apollo Walk of Fame in Harlem on Monday.

It was a star-studded event outside the theater with Clive Davis, Mary J. Blige and Fat Joe in attendance.

They sang his praises as a recording artist, songwriter and producer.

In receiving the honor, Babyface thanked his music partners, fans and God.

âI never imagined that I would get this,â he said. âI never saw myself actually being here at the Apollo. I didnât want to perform here because I didnât want to get booed. I didnât get booed, so I am so glad I came here to the Apollo.â

Mondayâs event with Babyface was the preview to the Apollo Spring Benefit, which is being held Tuesday evening.

The acclaimed artist will receive the Apolloâs inaugural Legacy Award during the benefit.

Multi-platinum recording artist Usher, will also be honored at the benefit with the 2024 Icon Award.
